Key Arguments: The bill may restrict freedom of speech.
Terms like 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are not clearly defined.
The bill gives ACMA excessive power to determine what is false, misleading, or deceptive.
Government communications, mainstream media, and entertainment are exempted, creating a double standard.
There is a risk of silencing dissent against the government.
Freedom of speech is an international human right that must be protected.
Notable Quotes: The terms ‘misinformation’ and ‘disinformation’ are not clearly defined and will give ACMA the power to determine what is false, misleading or deceptive.
There is a very real risk in passing this bill, that those who disagree with the government of the day will be silenced on a whole range of issues.

Freedoms of speech and communication is an international human right and must be supported as stated in the UN Declaration of Human Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
